tuv.seg: "This is a source term, which contains a comma","c'est un terme, qui contient une virgule"
"This is a source term, which contains a comma","Ala enn term sours, ki ena enn virgil"
...but the same characters are displayed properly in the Editing pane: the extension and the file encoding do not match.
...me mem karakter afise dan pano Editer: lextension ek lenkodaz file-la pas koresponn.
<a1>OmegaT</a1> automatically detects glossary files in this folder when a project is opened.
<a1>OmegaT</a1> pou detek otomatikman bann file gloser dan sa folder-la letan enn proze ouver.
<e0>Note: </e0>Of course there are other ways and means to create a simple file with tab delimited entries.
<e0>Pran not: </e0>Biensir ena lezot fason ek mwayin pou kre enn sinp file avek lantre delimite par tabilasion.
<shortcut> must be of the following form: 0 or more <c0><modifier></c0> followed by 0 or 1 <c1><event></c1> followed by 1 <c2><key></c2>, where:
<shortcut> bizin ekrir sa fason la: 0 ou plis <c0><modifikater></c0> swivi par 0 ouswa 1 <c1><levennman></c1> swivi par 1 <c2><tous></c2>, kot:
<u0>Microsoft Terminology Collection</u0> can be downloaded in nearly 100 languages and can serve as a cornerstone IT glossary.
Kapav download <u0>Microsoft Terminology Collection</u0> dan preske 100 langaz. Li kapav servi kouma enn fondman pou enn gloser informatik.
A character in the Greek block (simple <u0> block</u0>)
Enn karakter dan blok Grek (sinp <u0> blok</u0>)
A dialog opens, allowing you to enter the source term, target term and any comments you may have:
Enn bwat dialog pou ouver ki pou permet ou azout term sours, term sib ek ninport ki komanter ki ou le.
A nice collection of useful regex cases can be found in <a0>OmegaT</a0> itself (see Options > Segmentation).
<a0>OmegaT</a0> mem ena enn bon koleksion lexpresion regilie deza (get Opsion > Segmantasion).
Enn karakter ki pa enn nimero: [^0-9]
Enn karakter ki pa enn karakter lespasman: [^\s]
Enn karakter ki pa enn karakter enn mo: [^\w]
A number of interactive tools are available to develop and test regular expressions.
Ena bokou zouti interaktif ki permet devlop ek teste lexpresion regilie.
Enn karakter lespasman: lespas, tabilasion, retour lalign [ \t\n\x0B\f\r]
Also supported is the CSV format.
Any character except a, b, or c (negation)
Ninport ki karakter exsepte a, b, ou c (negasion)
Any character except one in the Greek block (negation)
Ninport ki karakter exsepte karakter blok Grek (negasion)
Any letter except an uppercase letter (subtraction)
Ninport ki let exsepte let maziskil (soustraksion)
Anything after the "//" will be ignored.
Seki apre "//" pas pou pran kont.
As entries can mix words from priority and non priority glossaries, the words from the priority glossary are displayed in bold.
Etan done ki enn lantre kapav mix gloser prioriter ek non prioriter, bann mo gloser prioriter afise an gra.
As the existing content will not be touched, damage to an existing file would be limited.
Etan done ki konteni existan pa pou modifie, pa pou ena erer dan file existan.
Lekritir otomatik/Montre otomatikman bann sigzestion pertinan
Before the spell check function can be used, a suitable dictionary or dictionaries (i.e. for your target language) must be installed.
Avan ou kapav itiliz fonksion verifikater lortograf, ou bizin instal enn ouswa plizier diksioner en fonksion ou langaz sib.
Check that your dict files are in the correct folder (or in a subfolder below it).
Chek si ou file dict dan bon folder (ouswa dan enn subfolder sa folder la).
Comment fields are separated by a comma ','.
Bann komanter separe par enn virgil ','.
Kopie bann file dan folder sours...
Dictionaries in <a0>OmegaT</a0> are based on the StarDict or on the Lingvo DSL format.
Diksioner dan <a0>OmegaT</a0> baze lor format StarDict ouswa Lingvo DSL.
Does the folder contain three files of the same name, with extensions?
Eski folder la ena trwa file mem nom, avek lextansion?
Download the file - it should be a <f0>tarball</f0> archive (extension <e1>tar.bz</e1> or <e2>tar.bz2</e2>).
Download file la â€“ li pou enn arsiv <f0>tarball</f0> (lextansion <e1>tar.bz</e1> ouswa <e2>tar.bz2</e2>).
Empty lines are accepted and comment lines should start with "//".
Lalign vid aksepte ek lalign komanter bizin koumans avek "//".
Enables case-insensitive matching (by default, the pattern is case-sensitive).
Permet ou fer bann resers san respekt maziskil (par defo, resers respekt maziskil).
English: the same check as above, but concerning consonants ("a", not "an")
Angle: mem verifikasion ki laho, me pou konsonn ("a", not "an")
English: words, beginning with vowels, should generally be preceded by "an", not "a"
Angle: bann mo ki koumans par vwayel mars normalman ek "an", pa "a"
For example, <e0>a+</e0> will match the aaa in <e1>aaabbb</e1>
Par exanp, <e0>a+</e0> pou match aaa dan <e1>aaabbb</e1>
For example, <e0>a+?</e0> will match the first <e1>a</e1> in <e2>aaabbb</e2>
Par exanp, <e0>a+?</e0> pou match premie <e1>a</e1> dan <e2>aaabbb</e2>
For example, in the default OmegaT shortcuts
Par exanp, pou shortcut OmegaT par defo
For example, this is the backslash character
Glossaries are files created and updated manually for use in <a0>OmegaT</a0>.
Enn gloser, li enn file ki finn kree ek aktialize manielman pou itilizasion dan <a0>OmegaT</a0>.
Glossary files are simple plain text files containing three-column, tab-delimited lists with the source and target terms in the first and second columns respectively.
Bann file gloser, zot bann sinp file text avek trwa kolonn ki form trwa lalis delimite par tabilasion avek term sours ek term sib dan premie ek deziem kolonn respektivman.
Glossary/Display Context Description for TBX Glossaries
Gloser/Afis deskripsion kontex pou bann gloser TBX
Gloser/Itiliz lematizasion pou bann lantre gloser
Highlighting it in the Glossary pane and then rightclicking insets at the cursor position in the target segment.
Highlight sa mo-la dan pano Gloser ek fer enn click drwa lor li apre ki ou finn met cursor dan bon pozission dan segman sib.
How to download and install dictionaries
If an <a0>OmegaT</a0> project contains one or more glossaries, any terms in the glossary which are also found in the current segment will be automatically displayed in the Glossary viewer.
Si enn proze <a0>OmegaT</a0> ena enn (ouswa plizier) gloser, tou bann term gloser-la ki dan segman an kour afise otomatikman dan pano Gloser.
If it is <e0>tar.bz</e0>, you have forgotten to unpack (untar) it.
Si li <e0>tar.bz</e0>, ou finn blie dekonpres (desarsiv) li.
If only one file is present, check its extension.
Si ena enn sel file, get so lextansion.
If the file already exists, no attempt is done to verify the format or the character set of the file: the new entries will always be in tab-separated format and UTF-8.
Si file-la deza existe, pa pou ena verifikasion so format ou so set karakter: bann nouvo lantre pou touzour format text separe par tabilasion ek UTF-8.
If they do not conflict with system shortcuts, they should be available from within OmegaT.
Si zot pa inkonpatib avek bann shortcut sistem, zot pou itilizab depi OmegaT mem.

If you are on a Mac and you want to add a <k0> <k1>Shift</k1> <k2>Command</k2> <k3>S</k3> </k0> shortcut to <m4> <g5>Tools</g5> <g6>Statistics</g6> </m4>, add the following line to your <f7>MainMenuShortcuts.properties</f7>:

Si ou lor Mac ek ou oule azout enn shortcut <k0> <k1>Shift</k1> <k2>Command</k2> <k3>S</k3> </k0> pou <m4> <g5>Tools</g5> <g6>Statistics</g6> </m4>, azout lalign swivan dan <f7>MainMenuShortcuts.properties</f7>:
If you have an existing terminology handling system it is quite possible it offers the export of terminology data via TBX format.
Si ou ena enn sistem zestion termilozik, li posib ki li propoz exportasion data terminolozik via format TBX.
If you want to use <k0> <k1>Shift</k1> <k2>Ctrl</k2> <k3>O</k3> </k0> to open a project, modify your <f4>MainMenuShortcuts.properties</f4> as follows:
Si ou le itiliz <k0> <k1>Shift</k1> <k2>Ctrl</k2> <k3>O</k3> </k0> pou ouver enn proze, sanz ou <f4>MainMenuShortcuts.properties</f4> kouma:
In OmegaT, select <g0>Options > Spell Checking</g0>, then click <g1>Choose </g1> beside the Dictionary file folder field.
Dan OmegaT, al lor <g0>Opsion > Preferans > Lortograf</g0>, ek click lor <g1>Choose </g1> akote beside the Dictionary file folder field.
In addition to the plain text format, TBX format is also supported as a read-only glossary format.
An plis format text brit, format TBX osi aksepte antan ki format gloser read-only.
In your file manager, create a new folder in a suitable location in which to store spelling dictionaries (D:\Translations\spellcheckers in the example below).
Dan ou file manager, kree enn nouvo folder pou enrezistr ou diksioner dan enn landrwa konvenab (D:\Translations\spellcheckers dan lexanp enba).
It is consequently able to use the huge range of free spelling dictionaries available for these applications.
Donk li kapav itiliz tou bann diksioner lib ki sa bann aplikasion-la itilize.
Mark bann segman tradi otomatikman depi folder oto
Most of the items that appear in the main menu can have a new shortcut assigned.
Laplipar bann item dan meni prinsipal kapav ena zot shortcut.
New terms can be added manually to the glossary file(s) during translation, for example in a text editor.
Kapav manielman azout enn nouvo term dan file gloser pandan tradiksion, ex. dan enn editer text.
Newly added terms will not be recognized once the changes in the text file have been saved.
Bann term ki finn fek azoute pa pou rekonet tan ki bann sanzman file text-la pa enrezistre.
No glossary file found in the "glossary" folder.
Pena oken file gloser dan folder "glossary".
Note that in addition to "source-target" dictionaries you can, using the Dictionary feature, obtain access to information such as:
Pran kont ki an plis bann diksioner "sours-sib", kapav, si itiliz fonksion Diksioner, aksed lezot linformasion kouma:
Note that in the above case, this is just half (or even less) of the story, as the target language (Slovenian) uses declension.
Pran kont ki dan sa lexanp-la, Note that in the above case, this is just half (or even less) of the story, as the target language (Slovenian) uses declension.
Note: the <f0>.tbx</f0> output of MultiTerm seems to not be reliable (November 2013), it is better to use the <f1>.tab</f1> output of MultiTerm instead.
Atension: output <f0>.tbx</f0> MultiTerm koumandir pa fiab (Novam 2013). Mie vo itiliz output <f1>.tab</f1> MultiTerm.

Nothing speaks against using Notepad++ on Windows, GEdit on Linux for instance or some spreadsheet program for this purpose: any application, that can handle UTF-8 (or UTF-16 LE) and that can show white space (so that you do not miss the required <k1>TAB</k1> characters) can be used.

Personn pa anpes ou itiliz par exanp Notepad++ dan Windows, GEdit dan Linux ouswa enn program spreadsheet pou kree enn gloser: ou kapav itiliz ninport ki aplikasion ki kapav pran an sarz UTF-8 (ouswa UTF-16 LE) ek afis bann karakter lespasman (pou kapav itiliz karater <k1>TAB</k1> ki obligatwar).
Nothing, but ends quoting started by \Q
Nanyen, me li fini sitasion koumanse par \Q
Nothing, but quotes all characters until \E
Nanyen, me li sit tou bann karakter ziska \E
Nothing, but quotes the following character.
Nanyen, me li sit karakter swivan.
Of course, the encoding must be compatible with both the languages contained, so Unicode is recommended.
Parski lankodaz-la bizin konpatib ant toule de langaz inplike, Unicode rekomande.
OmegaT has a built-in spell checker based on the spelling checker used in Apache OpenOffice, LibreOffice, Firefox and Thunderbird.
OmegaT ena enn verifikater lortograf integre ki base lor verifikater lortograf itilize par Apache OpenOffice, LibreOffice, Firefox ek Thunderbird.
On the Mac, the modifier <e0>meta</e0> must be used to specify the <e1>command</e1> key.
Lor Mac, bizin itiliz modifikater <e0>meta</e0> pou spesifie tous <e1>command</e1>.
Once the <f0>MainMenuShortcuts.properties</f0> file is modified, <a1>OmegaT</a1> must be relaunched to take the new shortcuts into account.
Enn fwa ki file <f0>MainMenuShortcuts.properties</f0> finn sanze, bizin restart <a1>OmegaT</a1> pou pran kont bann nouvo shortcut.
One or more of the above problems may have been fixed, but the project has not been reloaded.
Enn ouswa plizier problem mansione laho finn resoud, me proze-la pa finn reload.
Period, followed by an upper-case letter - possibly a space is missing between the period and the start of a new sentence?
Pwin, swivi par enn maziskil âˆ’ li posib ki enn lespas manke ant enn pwin ek enn nouvo fraz.
Problem: In the glossary pane, some characters are not displayed properly
Problem: Dan pano gloser, detrwa karakter pas bien afise
Problem: No glossary terms are displayed - possible causes:
Problem: Pena okenn term gloser ki afise. Posibilite:
Regex - Classes for Unicode blocks and categories
Regex âˆ’ Klas pou kategori ek blok Unicode
Regex - Examples of regular expressions in translations
Regex âˆ’ Exanp lexpresion regilie dan tradiksion
Regex tools and examples of use
Inskrir en tan ki tradiksion idantik
Right-click in the glossary pane or press <k0>Ctrl+Shift+G</k0> to add a new entry.
Right-click dan pano gloser ouswa fer <k0>Ctrl+Shift+G</k0> pou azout enn nouvo lantre.
Save then the file and relaunch <a0>OmegaT</a0>.
Search for the required language combination - for instance on the <u0>dictionary links given by the OmegaT Wiki</u0>.
Sers konbinezon langaz ki bizin â€“ get par exanp <u0>bann lien diksioner ki ena lor Wiki OmegaT</u0>
See <u0>The Regex Coach</u0> for Windows,Linux, FreeBSD versions of a stand-alone tool.
Get <u0>The Regex Coach</u0> pou enn zouti otonom ki fonksionn dan Windows, Linux ek FreeBSD.
See additional references and examples below.
Get plis referans ek lexanp anba.
Definir en tan ki tradiksion vid
Should you need more specific information, consult the <u0>Java Regex documentation</u0>.
Si ou bizin linformasion spesifik, get <u0>dokimantasion Java Regex</u0>.
Some of the dictionaries have no strings attached - i.e. are "Free to use", and others, like the selection above, are under the GPL license.
Sertin diksioner aksesib san kondision (setadir zot â€˜libâ€™) alors ki lezot (kouma seleksion lao la) soumi lisans GPL/GNU.

tu.note: VÃ©rifier apostrof pour guillemets ou inverted commas...

tuv.seg: Strings can be enclosed by quotes ", which allows having a comma inside a string:
Bann lasen karakter kapav koumans ek fini par apostrof ", seki vedir kapav met virgil dan linteryer lasen karakter:
Pas par tou bann posibilite (maziskil, miniskil, 1e let, etc.)
Met selman 1e let fraz en maziskil
Met 1e let tou bann mo dan seleksion en maziskil
TBX - Term Base eXchange - is the open, XML-based standard for exchanging structured terminological data, TBX has been approved as an international standard by LISA and ISO.
TBX â€“ Term Base eXchange â€“ li enn standard lib, baze lor XML, ki itilize pou esanz data terminolozik striktire. TBX finn aprouve antan ki norm internasional par LISA ek ISO.
Terms in the current segment which <a2>OmegaT</a2> finds in the glossary file(s) are displayed in the Glossary pane:
Segman en kour so bann term ki <a2>OmegaT</a2> trouve dan file gloser-la pou afise dan pano Gloser:
The character with octal value 0mnn (0 <= m <= 3, 0 <= n <= 7)
Karakter ki ena valer oktal 0mnn (0 <= m <= 3, 0 <= n <= 7)
The character with octal value 0n (0 <= n <= 7)
Karakter ki ena valer oktal 0n (0 <= n <= 7)
The character with octal value 0nn (0 <= n <= 7)
Karakter ki ena valer oktal 0nn (0 <= n <= 7)
The character x, except the following...
Karakter x, exsepte pou seki suiv...
The contents of glossary files are kept in memory and are loaded when the project is opened or reloaded.
File gloser so konteni garde dan memwar ek sarze kan ouver ouswa resarz proze.
The contents of the glossary pane will be updated accordingly.
Konteni pano gloser-la pou aktialize en fonksion.
The control character corresponding to x
Karakter kontrol ki koresponn avek x
The default OmegaT shortcuts are available from Sourceforge: <u0>Default OmegaT Shortcuts</u0>
Shortcut OmegaT par defo disponib lor Sourceforge: <u0>Shortcut OmegaT par defo</u0>
The default OmegaT shortcuts for the Mac are also available from Sourceforge, they all use "meta" instead of "ctrl": <u0>Default OmegaT Shortcuts for the Mac</u0>
Shortcut OmegaT par defo lor Mac ousi disponib lor Sourceforge, zot tou itiliz "meta" en plas "ctrl": <u0>Shortcut OmegaT par defo pou Mac</u0>
The encoding of glossaries is determined automatically.
The extension must be <f0>.txt</f0> or <f1>.utf8</f1> (if not, it will be added).
So lextansion bizin <f0>.txt</f0> ouswa <f1>.utf8</f1> (sinon li pou insere otomatikman).
The file does not need to exist when setting it, it will be created (if necessary) when adding a glossary entry.
File-la pa bizin existe letan konfigirasion, li pou kree (si neseser) kan azoute premie lantre dan gloser.
The first is the shortcut for <g0>Open Project</g0>, the second for <g1>Create Glossary Entry</g1>.
Premie-la shortcut pou <g0>Open Project</g0>, deziem-la pou <g1>Create Glossary Entry</g1>.
The following example shows Merriam Webster 10th dictionary "in action":
Sa lexanp-la montre diksioner Merriam Webster 10th â€˜an aksionâ€™:
The following list includes expressions you may find useful when searching through the translation memory:
Bann lexpresion dan lalis swivan kapav itil si ou fer enn resers dan memwar tradiksion:
The full syntax for keystrokes (shortcuts) is defined in the following Java 1.6 documentation from Oracle (bottom of page): <u0>Java 1.6 keystrokes shortcuts</u0>
Sintax komplett pou bann tous (shortcut) presise dan dokimantasion Java 1.6 edite par Oracle (anba paz): <u0>Java 1.6 keystrokes shortcuts</u0>
The glossary file does not have the correct encoding.
File gloser pena enn ankodaz korek.
The glossary file does not have the correct extension (.tab, .utf8 or .txt).
File gloser pena bon lextension (.tab, .utf8 ouswa .txt).
The glossary function only finds exact matches with the glossary entry (e.g. does not find inflected forms etc.).
Fonksion gloser trouv zis bann mo ki koresponn exacteman avek bann lantre gloser (ex. li pa rekonet bann form konzige).
The items are not separated with a TAB character.
Bann eleman pa separe par karakter TAB.
The location of the <f0>.tbx</f0> file must be within the <f1>/glossary</f1> folder, but it can be in a deeper folder (e.g., <f2>glossary/sub/MyGlossary.tbx</f2>).
File <f0>.tbx</f0> la bizin dan folder <f1>/glossary</f1>, me li kapav dan enn subfolder (ex.: <f2>glossary/sub/MyGlossary.tbx</f2>).
The location of the file must be within the <f2>/glossary</f2> folder, but it can be in a deeper folder (e.g., <f3>glossary/sub/glossary.txt</f3>).
File-la bizin dan folder <f2>/glossary</f2>, me il kapav dan enn subfolder (ex.: <f3>glossary/sub/glossary.txt</f3>).
The location of the writable glossary file can be set in the <g0>Project > Properties ... </g0>dialog.
Kapav sanz lanplasman file gloser modifiab-la dan dialog <g0>Proze > Propriete... </g0>.
The possible keyevents (keys) are listed in the following Java 1.6 documentation from Oracle: <u0>Java 1.6 keyEvents description</u0>
Bann evennman tous (keyevents) posib liste dan dokimantasion Java 1.6 edite par Oracle: <u0>Java 1.6 keyEvents description</u0>
The project setting allows one to enter a name for a writable glossary file (see beginning of this chapter).
Ou kapav done enn nom file gloser ki modifiab dan paramet proze (get depi koumansman sa sapit-la).
Lextansion ki program-la rekonet se <f1>TXT</f1> avek <f2>UTF8</f2>
The regular expressions (or regex for short) used in searches and segmentation rules are those supported by Java.
Lexpresion regilie (ou regex) itilize dan resers ek reg segmantasion li bann lexpresion itilize par Java.
The results from the priority glossary (by default, glossary/glossary.txt) appear in first places in the Glossary pane and in TransTips.
Rezilta gloser prioriter (glossary/glossary.txt) aparet an premie dan pano Gloser ek dan TransTips.
The shortcut definition file must be named <f0>MainMenuShortcuts.properties</f0> and must contain at most one shortcut definition per line.
File definision shortcut bizin apel <f0>MainMenuShortcuts.properties</f0>, ek bizin ena maximum enn definision shortcut par lalign.

The shortcut definition syntax is the following: <c0><menu item code>=<shortcut></c0>, where <e1><menu item code></e1> is a code taken from the tables below and <e2><shortcut></e2> is a combination of pressed keys specified by the user

Sintax pou ekrir enn definision shortcut li: <c0><kod litem meni>=<shortcut></c0>, kot <e1><kod litem meni></e1> li enn kod ki trouv dan bann tablo anba-la ek <e2><shortcut></e2> li enn konbinezon ki ou finn spesifie
The source term does not have to be a single-word item, as the next example shows:
Term sours-la pa neseserman enn sel mo, kouma dan sa lexanp-la:
The third column can be used for additional information.
Trwaziem kolonn-la li kapav itilize pou lezot linformasion.

tu.note: English and French do not match.

tuv.seg: The underlined item "pop-up menu" can be found in the glossary pane as "pojavni menu".
Kapav trouv item souligne "pop-up menu" dan pano Gloser kouma "pojavni menu".
The vocabulary entry can have a comment added.
Lantre vokabiler kapav ena enn ouswa plizier komanter.
The word before the = sign is the source term, and its translation is (or are) the words after =.
Bann mo avan sign =, zot bann term sours. Bann mo apre sign =, zot bann tradiksion.
There are no terms in the current segment which match any terms in the glossary.
Okenn term dan segman an kour match enn term dan gloser.
There is no EXACT match between the glossary entry and the source text in your document - for instance plurals.
Pena enn EXACT match ant lantre gloser ek text sours dan ou dokiman (par exanp, diferans singilie/pliryel).
There should be three files, with extensions <e1>dz, idx </e1>and <e2>ifo</e2>.
Pou ena trwa file avek lextansion <e1>dz, idx </e1>ek <e2>ifo</e2>.

They generally follow much the same pattern (for an example from the Regular Expression Tester see below): the regular expression (top entry) analyzes the search text (Text box in the middle) , yielding the hits, shown in the result Text box.

Zot tou normalman parey (get anba pou enn lexanp Regular Expression Tester): lexpresion regilie (lantre laho) analiz text resers (bwat text omilie), met tou korespondans ki li finn trouve ensam ek afis zot dan bwat text resilta.
This chapter is intended for advanced users, who need to define their own variants of segmentation rules or devise more complex and powerful key search items.
Sa sapit-la li pou bann itilizater avanse, ki bizin definir zot prop reg segmantasion ouswa fer bann resers pli konplex ek avanse.
This format is the same as the tab separated one: source term, target term.
Format-la li parey kouma separasion par tabilasion: term sours, term sib.
This is much the same as the above example.
Li preske parey lexanp laho la.
This is required if you would like to enter any of the meta characters !$()*+.<>?[\]^{|} to match as themselves.
Li neseser si ou bizin servi enn meta karakter swivan !$()*+.<>?[\]^{|} pou ki li match limem.
To install spelling dictionaries, follow this procedure:
To install the necessary files for the StarDict format, proceed as follows:
Pou instal bann file StarDict neseser, bizin:
To use an existing glossary, simply place it in the <f0>/glossary</f0> folder after creating the project.
Pou itiliz enn gloser, met li sinpleman dan folder <f0>/glossary</f0> apre kreasion proze.

Updating a glossary file is thus rather simple: press <k0>Ctrl+Shift+G</k0> and enter the new term, its translation and any comments you may have (ensuring you press tab between the fields) and save the file.

Savedir li bien sinp aktializ enn file gloser: apiy lor <k0>Ctrl+Shift+G</k0> ek ekrir nouvo term-la, so tradiksion ek ninport ki komanter ki ou le (fer atension met enn tab ant sak lantre) ek save file-la.
Use Terms Appearing Separately in the Source Text
Itiliz bann term ki aparet separeman dan text sours
Use untar utility (or its equivalent, for instance<f0> winrar</f0> in Windows) to extract its contents into the project folder "Dictionary".
